intro: Rubus apiculatus subsp. lauracensis, commonly known as the Lauracan raspberry, is a shrub native to the mountainous regions of southern Europe. It produces small, aggregate fruits that are typically red when ripe, with a tart flavor. The plant has trifoliate leaves with serrated edges and thorny stems typical of the Rubus genus. It thrives in well-drained soils and prefers full sun to partial shade. This subspecies is valued for both its ornamental appeal and its use in local culinary traditions.
